rules.natural: Either device1 uses organic materials, or it meets energy standards.
Provided that device1 qualifies for a green subsidy, then either it uses bamboo components or it does not violate the Sustainability Act.
Device1 qualifies for a green subsidy, or it qualifies for a tax credit.
Whenever device1 qualifies for a tax credit, it follows that either it uses bamboo components or it does not violate the Sustainability Act.
If manufacturer1 published an eco guide, then device1 is approved for market.
Under the condition that manufacturer1 distributed an eco guide, it follows that it published an eco guide.
If device1 meets energy standards, then it is approved for market.
Whenever agency1 reviewed the environmental impact, it conducted an audit.

Under the condition that agency1 issued a compliance certificate, then if it conducted an audit, it follows that if it is not the case that either device1 uses bamboo components or it does not violate the Sustainability Act, then device1 is not banned from import.

Provided that agency1 issued a warning letter, then if it conducted an audit, it follows that if it is not the case that either device1 uses bamboo components or it does not violate the Sustainability Act, then device1 is not banned from import.
If agency1 completed a field inspection, then it issued a compliance certificate.
Either agency1 completed a field inspection, or it completed a document review.
If agency1 completed a document review, then it issued a warning letter.
Under the condition that manufacturer1 sourced bamboo sustainably, it verified the supply chain.
Either manufacturer1 sourced bamboo sustainably, or it used alternative materials.
If manufacturer1 used alternative materials, then device1 does not violate the Sustainability Act.
Whenever device1 passed the sustainability check, it uses bamboo components.
Provided that agency1 initiated an investigation, then manufacturer1 failed verification.
If device1 requires certification, then it is compliant.
Under the condition that device1 requires certification, it is not compliant.
Either device1 requires certification, or it does not have a penalty.
If device1 has renewable packaging, then it is approved for market.
Either device1 has renewable packaging, or it has recycled components.
Whenever device1 passes the safety test, then if it has recycled components, it is approved for market.
Under the condition that device1 passes the emissions test, then if it has recycled components, it is approved for market.
If it is not the case that if device1 uses organic materials then it is approved for market, then it has a penalty.
Provided that it is not the case that either device1 uses bamboo components or it does not violate the Sustainability Act, then device1 is banned from import.
Whenever it is not the case that if manufacturer1 verified the supply chain then device1 passed the sustainability check, then agency1 initiated an investigation.
If it is not the case that if it is not the case that either device1 passes the safety test or it passes the emissions test then it has a recall, then it has a lawsuit.
Under the condition that it is not the case that if it is not the case that manufacturer1 distributed an eco guide then it did not receive funding, then it received a fine.
Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that device1 is approved for market then it does not have an export license, then it violates the Sustainability Act.
If manufacturer1 did not distribute an eco guide, then it received funding.
If device1 is not approved for market, then it has an export license.

Device1 does not have a lawsuit.
Device1 does not use bamboo components.
Manufacturer1 did not receive a fine.
